title: Replay Resolution is crappy.  Help?
body: Yeah title.  Whenever i get the replays back the video is blurry and resolution is crap.  Also, the audio is weird.  Sounds like nails on a chalkboard.

replies.body: LOOOOOOL.  No no I'm sure your better than crappy xD
Haha; saw the title - and originally thought it was about me. Had a good laugh out of it.
Its the same for me; I've tried it on a new highlight replay on a new game and on VLC but there is 0 improvement just like MiniZergling said.

Are you viewing an entire replay launched from inside the client in match history, or are you viewing a *Highlight* from inside your highlights folder using another program to view it? If it's the latter, which program are you using to view the highlight?

Ah, so Windows Media Player has some issues playing back those files. I recommend trying either opening it in your web browser or in another media player such as [**VLC**](http://www.videolan.org/vlc/index.html).

Let me know if that fixed your issues with Highlights!

Yeah heh no.  The quality is still crappy, like I could record the replay with obs and post it on youtube if you wanna see for yourself.  And the sound isn't as bad, but it is definitely still there.  It doesn't show up in the beginning, then in the mid it shows up and until the end.

Can you test this with an entirely new highlight recorded from a different match replay and open it with a different video player other than Windows Media Player.

This will give us a fresh start. Does this happen with an entirely new highlight?

I did and it was much better.  The quality was better, not as refined in game, but so much better.  The sound was normal.  What's weird is that if I played it with windows the sound would be all weird and viewing it with anything else afterwards would retain the weirdness.

Gotcha, I'm glad to hear things worked the second time around. We've had a lot of reported issues with viewing replays with Windows Media Player, so I'd be sure to avoid it in the future. 

If you have any other questions, let me know.

Yeah this doesn't seem to help me at all, I've had the same issue for a long time, even tried VLC like you suggested and while there is improvement it's so minuscule that you can barely even notice it.
I dont get it I record league plays when i post on youtube it has bad quality and graphics
